value.title: Power BI DAX Measures: Understanding Filter Context using SUMX Example (I.C.A.N. Rule) Part 1 of 2
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” with the 4-easy-step approach of the I.C.A.N. value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
value.excerpt: It happens often in Power BI calculations and reports that you need to concatenate a list of values from a column. You can do this concatenation in Power Query or DAX. value.title: Dynamic Banding or Grouping in Power BI   Using DAX Measures   Choose the Count of Bins
value.excerpt: Banding (or binning or grouping) is a scenario that can be implemented both statically and dynamically in Power BI. value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More »
